isis.stitle: DOUBLE DIAPHRAGM MGM SPRING BRAKE - INSPECTION

step1.para: The plastic WEATHER SEAL END CAP ( Figure 5) requires no positioning or maintenance, but must be snapped tightly in place. Inspect the cap for damage and replace as necessary. Units equipped with a WEATHER SEAL END CAP must be equipped with a rubber "O" ring ( Figure 6) to ensure proper sealing of the spring brake chamber.

figure.caption: Figure 6. Plastic End Cap with "O" Ring

step1.para: Visually inspect the exterior surfaces of the unit for signs of damage from outside sources, corrosion and/or rust. If any of these are seen or suspected, cautiously remove the complete combination chamber assembly after releasing (caging) the spring brake.

Inspect SERVICE BRAKE CLAMP RING (Item 2, Figure 1) to be sure it is securely in place and damage free. If any damage is seen or suspected, cautiously remove and replace the complete double diaphragm spring brake assembly.
Check to ensure the MOUNTING STUD HEX NUTS (Item 11, Figure 1) are tightened to 100 to 115 ft-lbs. (136 to 156 N•m) torqueand washers are in place between the nut and the bracket.
Inspect air lines, hoses and fittings (Item 4, Figure 1) attached to chamber. Replace any damaged or leaking parts. Tighten fittings to 25 ft-lbs. (34 N•m) torque into the chamber air inlet ports.

Inspect the PISTON ROD (Item 5, Figure 1) to be sure it is working free, not bent, not binding and is square to the chamber bottom with ± 3° in any direction at any point in the stroke of the chamber. If the PISTON ROD is not square, make corrections by repositioning the chamber on the mounting bracket and/or by shimming the slack adjuster to the right or left on the camshaft as required.

Inspect the YOKE ASSEMBLY (Item 6, Figure 1) being sure YOKE PIN (Item 7, Figure 1) is installed and locked into place with a COTTER PIN (Item 8, Figure 1). Replace any damaged, worn or missing parts. Tighten the YOKE LOCKNUT (Item 9, Figure 1) to 25 to 35 ft-lbs. (34 to 47 N•m) torque.
On units equipped with a DUST BOOT, check the BOOT for damage and replace as necessary.

On units equipped with an external BREATHER TUBE (Item 10, Figure 1), be sure both ends of the connector tube are engaged a minimum of 1/2 inch into each of the flexible elbows ( Figure 7). The tube must be glued to both of the elbows with a high quality rubber adhesive. These units must be mounted with the BREATHER TUBE in the upper half of the non-pressure chamber facing away from the road surface ( Figure 8).

caution.para: Failure to operate any MGM Model Series "TR-T" and "TR-LP3-T" chamber without the EXTERNAL BREATHER TUBE and END COVER CAP being installed and in good condition will cause premature failure of the spring brake assembly and void any warranty.
